text: May says reasonably that if vote against no deal and in favour of extension, key issue of Britain’s place in Europe  still unresolved.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: May, anticipating defeat, said there will be free vote tomorrow on ruling out leaving with no deal.  If vote goes through, vote on Thursday to seek extension.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Brexit deal defeated by 149.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Hi Karla. It is: Ewen.macaskill@gmail.com
author: ewenmacaskill

text: 35 mins late. Lineker apologises for delaying ten o’clock news. Not much happening anyway, he jokes.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: I love football but BBC has lost sense of priorities, delaying news at ten because cup game between Southampton and Derby goes to extra time.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: More than third of Tory MPs vote against May. Pretty disastrous day for PM and Conservatives.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: More than a million readers contribute financially to the Guardian
author: ewenmacaskill

text: UK joins chorus of disapproval after Trump praises assault on Guardian reporter

text: Although White Crow portrays Soviet Union in bad light, he acknowledged it did foster Nureyev talent, gave opportunity to child from poor background. Does not know iyet if it will be shown in Russia.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Hare, speaking at London Film Festival about White Crow, describes Nureyev birthplace Ufa as “nasty place”.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Ralph Fiennes, David Hare and cast of brilliant movie about Nureyev defection White Crow. Fiennes, a Russophile and fluent Russian speaker, says hopes it will be shown in Russia.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: That took a long time.....Liam Fox pulls out of Saudi event over alleged murder of Jamal Khashoggi

text: I met Khashoggi a few times, including earlier this year.  I could never work out just how much of a dissident he was. Istanbul answered that.  HIs final piece for the Washington Post published today.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Just saw Mike Leigh's Peterloo, part of London Film Festival.  Some of the dialogue stilted but overall great to see an episode of working-class history portrayed.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: 'Golden passports' threaten European security, warns EU commissioner
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Fashion cannot avoid daily reality. The uncertainty of Brexit, of Trump.  In such times, designers seek solace in old reliables such as Harris Tweed....
author: ewenmacaskill

text: A passionate plea from Lindsay Mackie for rescue ofThe Scotsman. Journalists who once worked on it regarded as a "Glorious Privilege".
author: ewenmacaskill

text: 'Nasty, nasty man': Guardian reporter on being insulted by Trump and breaking the Snowden story
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Thursday night......
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Another flash of petulance from Niall Ferguson who reprimands dinner guests for failing to listen. He says most of participants at Yalta conference are Ukrainian so should be interested in discussion on EU.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Niall Ferguson at Yalta conference dinner sounds upset that panel discussion being largely ignored. He says Americans were listened to at lunchtime and so Europeans, including him, should be listened to as well.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Condi Rice: The party in power always lose at mid-terms. Larry Summers on same panel echoes this:Republicans to do worse than conventional wisdom suggests.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Condi Rice says she is less concerned about US drifting away from Europe than about European cohesion.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: Republican Condoleeza Rice at Yalta conference admits some of Trump foreign policy “harmful” and declines to address whether he knows what he is doing.
author: ewenmacaskill

text:
Big Brother Watch said of European Court judgement:
    “This landmark judgment confirming that the UK’s mass spying breached fundamental rights vindicates Mr Snowden’s courageous whistleblowing..he UK has adopted most authoritarian surveillance regime of any Western state."
author: ewenmacaskill

text: On European judgement on Snowden revelations: Jim Killock, of Open Rights Group, said:“Viewers of the BBC drama, the Bodyguard, may be shocked to know that the UK actually has the most extreme surveillance powers in a democracy."  He adds the UK has since increased its powers.
author: ewenmacaskill

text: GCHQ data collection violated human rights, Strasbourg court rules
author: ewenmacaskill
